skill.name: wrangler
skill.description: Deploy and manage Cloudflare Workers, Pages, KV, R2, D1, and other Cloudflare services using the `wrangler` CLI.
skill.summary: Deploy and manage Cloudflare Workers, Pages, KV, R2, D1, and other Cloudflare services using the `wrangler` CLI.
skill.author: Dicklesworthstone

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. The skill provides documentation for the legitimate Cloudflare wrangler CLI tool. Detected patterns (command references, infrastructure listings, crypto mentions) are standard devops documentation content, not malicious code. This is a legitimate infrastructure management skill with no security concerns.

content.value_statement: Deploy and manage Cloudflare serverless infrastructure directly from your AI assistant. This skill enables deployment of Workers, Pages, KV storage, R2 object storage, and D1 databases using the official wrangler CLI.
actual_capabilities: Manage KV namespaces for key-value storage
Manage R2 buckets for object storage
Deploy static sites to Cloudflare Pages
limitations: Requires Cloudflare account and wrangler CLI authentication
Cannot modify Cloudflare account settings outside of worker deployments
Does not provide monitoring or alerting for deployed services

use_cases.title: Deploy Serverless Functions
use_cases.description: Deploy JavaScript or TypeScript serverless functions to Cloudflare Workers for edge computing workloads.

use_cases.title: Manage Data Storage
use_cases.description: Create and manage KV namespaces, R2 buckets, and D1 databases for application data storage needs.

use_cases.title: Host Static Sites
use_cases.description: Deploy static websites and applications to Cloudflare Pages with custom domains and configurations.

prompt_templates.title: Deploy a Worker
prompt_templates.prompt: Deploy my Cloudflare Worker to production using wrangler. The worker code is in the current directory.
prompt_templates.scenario: Quick deployment of a worker from current directory

prompt_templates.title: List All Resources
prompt_templates.prompt: List all deployed Cloudflare resources including workers, KV namespaces, R2 buckets, and D1 databases in my account.

prompt_templates.title: Manage KV Data
prompt_templates.prompt: List the keys in my KV namespace with ID <namespace-id> and show me how to put a new key-value pair.

prompt_templates.title: Database Operations
prompt_templates.prompt: Execute a SQL query on my D1 database named <database-name> to get the first 100 rows from the users table.
prompt_templates.scenario: Querying D1 databases for data retrieval

output_examples.input: Deploy my worker using wrangler deploy
output_examples.output:
Running: wrangler deploy

Uploaded my-worker (JavaScript)
Published my-worker
Addresses:
  - https://my-worker.my-subdomain.workers.dev

Worker deployed successfully!

Deployed Workers:
  - worker-api (active)
  - worker-images (active)
  - worker-auth (rolled back)

Run `wrangler deployments list <worker-name>` for deployment history.

best_practices: Use wrangler whoami to verify authentication before deployments
Test workers locally with wrangler dev before production deployment
Store sensitive values in secrets rather than environment variables
anti_patterns: Deploying directly to production without testing locally first
Hardcoding API tokens instead of using wrangler auth flow
Deploying workers without configuring appropriate routes and zones

faq.question: How do I authenticate with Cloudflare?
faq.answer: Run `wrangler login` to authenticate via browser. Use `wrangler whoami` to verify your current authentication status.

faq.question: Can I deploy workers from a CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. Use Cloudflare API tokens with CLOUDFLARE_API_TOKEN environment variable for automated deployments.

faq.question: What languages are supported for Workers?
faq.answer: JavaScript and TypeScript are fully supported. Workers can also be written in Rust, Python, and Go via WebAssembly.

faq.question: How do I manage secrets securely?
faq.answer: Use `echo "value" | wrangler secret put NAME` to add secrets. Secrets are encrypted at rest and not exposed in worker code.

faq.question: What is the difference between KV and R2?
faq.answer: KV is low-latency key-value storage for metadata and caching. R2 is S3-compatible object storage for files and large objects.

faq.question: Can I roll back a deployment?
faq.answer: Yes. Use `wrangler deployments list` to see history and `wrangler deploy --env <previous-version>` to redeploy an older version.
